net.sourceforge.waters.model.compiler.context

Class SourceInfo

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sourceforge.waters.model.compiler.context.SourceInfo

  • public class SourceInfo
extends Object

    A link between the input and the output of the ModuleCompiler.

    Each item in the compiler output is associated with a source information record that enables the user to trace from which item in the original module the compiled item was produced, and which bindings were used. More specifically, the items of a ProductDESProxy are associated with SourceInfo records as follows.

    • Each AutomatonProxy object has a record pointing to the SimpleComponentProxy or VariableComponentProxy object from which it was produced.
    • Each StateProxy object has a record pointing to the SimpleNodeProxy object from which it was produced.
    • Each TransitionProxy object has a record pointing to a SimpleExpressionProxy object in the LabelBlockProxy of the edge from which the transition was produced.
    • Each EventProxy object has a record pointing to the EventDeclProxy object from which it was produced.
    Author:
    Robi Malik

      • toString

      • getSourceObject

        public Proxy getSourceObject()
        Gets the item in the source module associated with this source information record.

      • getBindingContext

        public BindingContext getBindingContext()
        Gets the binding context that indicates any variable substitutions, bindings, or aliases applied to the source object.

      • getParent

        public SourceInfo getParent()
        Gets the parent of this source information record. If a compiled module contains instances (InstanceProxy) that refer to a child module, then the child module is compiled with source information referencing to the elements of the child module. In addition, all these source information records contain a parent source information that references the instance in the parent module.

      • getRoot

        public SourceInfo getRoot()
        Gets the root parent of this source information record. This method returns the uppermost parent of this source information, which is either the source information itself (if the compiled module has no instances) or a source information referencing an instance in the original module that triggered compilation.
        See Also:
        getParent()

      • getGraphSourceInfo

        public SourceInfo getGraphSourceInfo()
        Gets a parent of this source information record that indicates a location within a label block in a graph of the compiled module. Due to aliasing, the source information of a compiled transition does not necessarily indicate a position within a graph. In such cases, this method can be used to navigate the contexts and find the closest location within a graph (which represents the item that a simulator would want to highlight).
        See Also:
        AliasBindingContext

      • getGraphSourceObject

        public Proxy getGraphSourceObject()
        Gets the closed graph item linked to this source information record. This method is equivalent to calling getGraphSourceInfo() followed by getSourceObject().

      • dump

        public void dump(StringBuilder builder)
